Ingrounds - Drainage
Installation complies with AS/NZS-3500 (2021), current IFC drawings & specifications
Inspection openings and/or clean outs have been installed
All drains are clear of debris and have been securely capped
Invert levels for drains and inspection openings have been checked against current IFC drawings
All drains have been tested
All drains have been backfilled and compaction completed
Ingrounds - Pumpwells/Tanks/Pits
Installation complies with AS/NZS-3500 (2021), current IFC drawings & specifications
Installation methods & materials are in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Invert levels for inlets, outlets and cover levels have been checked against current IFC drawings
Connection of drainage to pumpwell/tank/pit has been sealed/caulked/grouted both inside and outside
Cast in conduits to pump control panels are correctly sized and in accordance with current IFC drawings
Ingrounds - Cast in
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings
All pipe elements free of damage prior to install
Where practical, pipes water tested prior to the pour
Pipe grades and size have been checked
Invert levels and finished levels have been checked
PVC has been lagged (add photos)
HDPE fusion welds are witness marked
All cast in elements are clear of debris, securely capped & sealed prior to pour
Water has been poured into PVC for deep beam/thick slab pour
Unfixed pipes are tied to reo (where necessary)
Concrete pour details
Location and description of what has been cast in

Flexible connections are correct

Rough in is ready for a hydrostatic water test

Water Services (High & Low Level Rough In)
Pressure Pipework (for high & low level rough-in) checked off as below
Install Phase
If pex is being insulated with armaflex, a barrier of duct tape has been applied to all pex crimp fittings
All joints have been crimped correctly and to manufacturers spec
Spacing of clips and fixings for WaterPex as per AS3500.1.2021
Any pex through metal studs is entirely protected from sharp edges (achieve through additional oversized sleeving or suitable grommets)
Check has been undertaken to ensure no cross connections
All pex fittings are crimped and ready for 1500 kPa bump test
Rough In Fitting Install
Installation and location of tempering valve or T.M.V is correct (must be within access panel area)
Location of shower mixer is as per latest IFC
Location of lugged elbow is as per latest IFC
Location of WC water point is as per latest IFC
Location of vanity water points are as per latest IFC
Fit Off/ Fixture Install Toilets & Cisterns
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings & AS/NZS 3500 (2021)
Installation materials used in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Fixture has been checked for damage. Damaged fixtures do not get installed
Installation is aligned, level and secure
Flush pipe has been measured to suit the pan prior to being cut to size
Button flush plate is in working order and not damaged/scratched
Seat and accessories are secure and correct
DDA suite back rest installed correctly
Full visual inspection undertaken and all required elements having been installed
Pan trap is clear of debris
Flexible connections are correct with no twisting or kinks
Fixture has been left covered and protected and the area is clean

Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings & AS/NZS 3500 (2021)
Installation materials used in accordance with manufacturer requirements
All fixtures were checked for damage. Damaged fixtures do not get installed

All floor wastes and trap/s are clear of debris
All fixtures are covered and protected and the area is clean
Items installed

Vanity tapware installed - aligned, level, damage free (include photo)
Shower rail/rose installed - secure, damage free (include photo)
Shower mixer installed - secure, damage free (include photo)
Kitchen sink installed - aligned, level, damage free (include photo)
Kitchen mixer installed - aligned, level, damage free (include photo)
Kitchen underbench boiling & chilling unit installed & connected - (include photo)
Testing - Water Hold - Sewer & Stormwater Underslung
Pipe has been checked and is clear of blockage
Pipe work is securely clipped and ready to hold water
Open ends have been sealed
Test was conducted from stack riser 1m above the highest overflow point
Test was successful as it held water at an unchanged level for at least 30mins
Water was drained from the pipe at the end of the test
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Water Hold - Sewer, Stormwater & Down Pipe Stacks
Pipe has been checked and is clear of blockage
Pipe work is securely clipped and ready to hold water
Open ends have been sealed
Test was conducted from stack riser 1m above the highest overflow point
Test was successful as it held water at an unchanged level for at least 30mins
Water was drained from the pipe at the end of the test
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Potable Water - 1500kpa water test (not an air test)
Water test is being conducted on material that is rated to withstand 1500kpa
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
All in-wall mixer assemblies & pressure sensitive meters, etc have been isolated/removed from the test zone (these items are only rated to max 500kpa)
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Test consisted of slowly increasing the pressure to 1500kpa with the water feed shut off and the pressure held for not less than 30mins
Pressure in the testing area was slowly reduced back to neutral working conditions
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Potable Water - 500kpa water test pressure sensitive valves (not an air test)
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Test consisted of slowly increasing the pressure to 500kpa with the water feed shut off and the pressure held for not less than 30mins
Pressure in the testing area was slowly reduced back to neutral working conditions
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Potable Water - 1500kpa Bump Test Couta Fittings (not an air test)
Pressure sensitive valves have been removed from test section (Note: this test will damage pressure sensitive fittings)
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Pressure was slowly increased to 1500kpa and held for 2 minutes
Pressure was decreased to 1000kpa and held for 20secs, then immediately and rapidly the pressure was increased back to 1500kpa for a further 2 minutes.
The previous step has been repeated: Pressure was decreased to 1000kpa and held for 20secs, then immediately and rapidly the pressure was increased back to 1500kpa and held for 30 minutes.
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of 30minutes test. Add in comments (test duration etc)

Details
Hot water delivery time from cold to stable hot to be logged
Hot water delivery temperature to be logged
Test has been conducted to fully isolate CW supply to demonstrate HW is not delivered through TMV
System has been returned to working conditions
Temp and Time reading photos from each fitting must be taken at start & finish of test
